parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural

str2: Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: To change my place (abode), leave, depart, remove, pass over. From meta and the base of basis; to change place.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
Death, physical or spiritual. From thnesko; death.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Life, both of physical (present) and of spiritual (particularly future) existence. From zao; life.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: To love, wish well to, take pleasure in, long for; denotes the love of reason, esteem. Perhaps from agan; to love.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To love, wish well to, take pleasure in, long for; denotes the love of reason, esteem. Perhaps from agan; to love.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To remain, abide, stay, wait; with acc: I wait for, await. A primary verb; to stay.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Death, physical or spiritual. From thnesko; death.
